name: Aloft Bangkok - Sukhumvit 11

reviews.text: For three nights I recently stayed at the Aloft Bangkok. It’s my third visit and was as enjoyable as ever. The Hotel is conveniently located, and the staff is super friendly.
reviews.title: Service with a smile!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But there was one experience that I would like to share with everyone.
reviews.title: Great location, but double check the bill

reviews.text: I opted to stay in one of their Touch Rooms, which means you are given a Samsung Phone that acts as your room key, room controller, mobile phone and Wi-Fi hotspot when out of the Hotel. Also since it’s your lifeline with the Hotel, when outside, I decided to put it to the test.
reviews.title: confusion at reception desk..

reviews.text: The previous day, I had used the Hotel’s Tuk-Tuk service to go to a meeting not too far away, and it was a useful service. But on the day concerned, I had completed a meeting at a location closeby where I had been dropped off, but could not find a taxi to bring me back. So I thought I would call the Guest Services Desk using the phone “called Fingi” and see if they could dispatch the Tuk-Tuk and pick me up. It was 6pm and rush hour, which in Bangkok, is a bad time to look for taxis.
reviews.title: a Vision of W Hotels

reviews.text: Well, to my great surprise, the person answering the phone acknowledge my request, dispatched the Tuk-Tuk, it arrived after 10 minutes, and ten minutes later I was comfortably back in the Hotel.
reviews.title: Trendy and Comfortable Hotel

reviews.text: This is a hotel for people who want to be near the clubs and bars... The hotel is a good value for the money but the location is not for everyone. It is down Soi 11 where there is a lot of nightlife. If you want to party while in BKK then this is the place to stay. I checked in here as a place to stay for a few hours as my flight left early in the AM and I wanted to stay at an inexpensive Starwood Property. I prefer the Four Points Sheraton on Soi 15 over this Aloft. The hotel is almost at the end of the street which makes the walk to the BTS longer than I would want if I was to stay here while exploring Bangkok. This is a hotel for people who want a certain type of nightlife at their fingertips. With that being said it was just not for me... not due to the hotel but due to the location. It is typical Aloft Hotel.
reviews.title: This is a hotel for people who want to be near the clubs and bars

reviews.text: Aloft Hotel is a wonderful addition to Starwood Hotels in Bangkok.The warmth of the staff,as well as the unbeatable comfort of the beds (and the modern rooms) is something new. It is so
reviews.title: RELAX IN MODERN CONFORT

reviews.text: relaxing and the staff are typically wonderful Starwood team members.Having enjoyed Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit for many years this was an excellent "brother" hotel.
reviews.title: Relaxing end to our Thailand adventure.

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Brand New Hotel in So11

reviews.text: We decided to book this hotel after a pleasant stay in a hostel in Bangkok but in need of some total relaxation before we headed back to London. Glad we did, from the 32nd floor we felt the hustle and bustle of Bangkok drift away as we retreated to our room.
reviews.title: Brand new place

reviews.text: Very fancy and high tech rooms, friendly and helpful staff. They seemed a bit confused at times but that is only because the hotel has been opened for about 6 months. Although the bed boy in the front is not as useful as he should be I came to this hotel on 3 different occasions and every time I had to carry my own luggage up and down the stairs. The hotel is in an excellent location right across from BED club and around the corner from Q-bar, BED club has hip hop Tuesday night and Model Wednesday nights. There is a lot of excellent street food on Soi 11 and it is directly on the same block as the NANA train station. Their prices per night are really reasonable as it comes with free wifi. They also have a night club inside the hotel. If you are a starwood member or just on a semi budget but want a super comfortable room with amazing showers this is the place to go !
reviews.title: Super modern hotel only opened 6 months

reviews.text: My room comes with a phone. A proper phone that I can use to make calls to Australia without it costing $30 every couple of minutes. It has Facebook, Google maps and Twitter. I can take photos with it. Oh, and it turns the air conditioning on, changes channel on the TV, turns the lights off at night and sets the 'do not disturb' on the door. I can call the hotel from it and they will send a taxi to exactly where I am standing to take me back to the hotel. If the hotel sucked in every other aspect this one feature means that I now expect a phone from my next international hotel. Except it doesn't suck.
reviews.title: If Google ever did hotels, this would be how they would do it. Part hotel, part college campus.

reviews.text: HDMI? Don't mind if I do. I have a USB port in my wall point that connects to the 42" TV so I can plug my laptop in and play movies. There are plenty of universal power points for my stuff so no need for an adapter. No laptop? The TV includes Apple TV account so I can login to my account and play movies in HD. Oh, and free WiFi that's really, really fast so I could just watch YouTube or stream straight from the web. Did I mention the iPhone/iPod dock so I can play own music?
reviews.title: a great hotel experience, can only get better

reviews.text: The rooms have Paul Smith striped tiles in the shower. It's large and delivers a decent amount of water but there is no bath. The bed is typical SPG - very comfortable. The room size is adequate. The corridors to the room have a real atmosphere with clever lighting and colours.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, Colour Ambience and Great Place To Be In

reviews.text: The hotel itself is bright and funky, lots of floor to ceiling glass with neons and bright colours. It's a breath of fresh air compared to the predictable and functional hotels and a surprising change in direction for the SPG group. There are Vespa motorbikes as an art installation. They have clear glass bowl chairs suspended from the ceiling.
reviews.title: Gem of hotel

reviews.text: I came just for a weekend of shopping and fun. Brought my two young sons. Hotel has small blow up air mattresses for the kids, which they loved. Mini bar has condoms which I'm glad my older one didn't ask about ;). This hotel is suited to 20 something's but welcomes families too. The technology is superb! Free wifi throughout (why any hotel charges any more is beyond me). Plug ins for everything and Nickelodeon and Disney channel for the kids - Yea! Most hotels have only cartoon network or nothing. Rooms and furnishings are very modern, clean and nice looking. Ours was also very quiet. They have a small quickie shop in lobby where you can but a drink or snack and go - restaurants I did not try but they looked great. They have a billiards room and Mac computers everywhere. A night club/bar as well. Room service was fast but menu is limited - especially for breakfast options. The hotel tuk tuk is easy and we never waited more than a few minutes. Had a few glitches with phone not working in room but staff couldn't have been more helpful and kind. Very impressed with staff quality and responsiveness. Very professional staff and just falling over themselves to help us with anything and everything - a rare thing any where these days - can't say enough about the service here. We checked in late at night and K was amazing in sorting out hone problems we were having at 3am. The concierge desk was also great. Fun place to stay too! Will definitely stay here again!!
reviews.title: Very fun, trendy new hotel in the heart of the action

reviews.text: Aloft is a good hotel on a great road although a little at the far end of Soi 11. Dull lobby and univiting restaurants but very comfy rooms. ESP after we arranged the interconnecting rooms, it was very comfortable. Not a warm decor... A little business hotel like decor but extremely comfortable. Has good food options outside too and seven 11, supermarket etc. Watch out for taxi drivers who will swindle you since they want to take you to places to shop at where they get commissions then they abandon you. We had a terrible time on one day with practically no taxis ready to go anywhere but where hey wanted. Stick to the ferry and MRT. This pressure eases off after 6pm. :).
reviews.title: Great location on soi 11. Very comfy rooms good breakfast

reviews.text: Aloft staff is vet courtoues and try and help with taxis too. We stayed with our two kids and with interconnected rooms couldn't have asked for more. The concierge is more of an agent out to sell his tours and had no advice to offer. Got more help from the bell boys and people helping get taxis at the porch.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location for Young Groups
Impressed
reviews.text: Stayed at Aloft with a group of 30 colleagues on an incentive trip. Everything was arranged through the hotel: trips, meals, nights out etc and the whole thing ran smoothly and was great value.
As others have mentioned, the hotel is funky and high-tech. The bars and club are attractive and lively.
reviews.title: If you want service and single stay away from this place

description: Aloft Bangkok - Sukhumvit 11 is a vision of W Hotels, Aloft is modern, fresh & fun, offering a new twist in travel for travellers craving for a unique experience. Appealing to on-the-go and in-the-know travellers, Aloft Bangkok – Sukhumvit 11 is a preferred choice for the perceptive corporate and leisure traveller. All 296 Aloft guestrooms and suites feature the latest plug and play media technology and, along with all public areas, are equipped with high speed broadband and/or wireless internet access, free of charge. Whether you’re settling in or zipping out the door, you’ll find a host of helpful standard amenities to customize your experience. Revel in the trendy restaurant and entertainment area, that is Sukhumvit Soi 11, while still being within arm’s reach of commercial and shopping areas. Easily accessible, with Nana BTS Skytrain Station only 5 minutes away, our open loft-inspired layout gives our guests the space to get up and a-go-go. With Crave (all day dining), re:fuel, (grab ‘n’ go café), w xyz bar and splash, our zones are always abuzz with energy and action - an ideal place to be for Gen Y travellers.Catering for our savvy travellers’ needs, tactic provides 3 stylish meeting rooms and pre-function space covering 350 sq.m., all decked out with state-of-the-art audio visual and offers natural light to ensue your meetings will be the talk of the town. Aloft Bangkok – Sukhumvit 11 offers jet-setting style at a steal and brings urban cool to unexpected places, where anything can happen: energy flows, personalities mingle and opportunities abound.
